LONDON( AFP)- Prime Minister David Cameron has been damaged by his media chief's resignation over phone-hacking at a tabloid newspaper he headed and the row is unlikely to go away, commentators said Saturday. So far, our worst day in government, a senior aide from David Cameron 's Downing Street office told The Guardian, after Andy Coulson quit as chief of communications on Friday. already has been a Broadway play,... What: Barbara Walters , who had her own surgery to repair a faulty heart valve last year, addresses heart disease and the fear many have of a heart operation in A Matter of Life and Death. She talks to former Bill Clinton , David Letterman , Robin Williams and Regis Philbin , celebrities who've had heart surgeries. She also talks to doctors, including her own, about prevention and the warning signs of heart trouble.

his first game since a two-game suspension for violating the NBA's steroid policy, had 14 points and seven rebounds for the Sixers.`` Toni Kukoc gave us a big lift off the bench,'' Allen Iverson said. Mr David Cameron told the BBC that he believed Mr Andy Coulson had already made amends for`` bad things'' that happened during his editorship, and insisted that the communications chief deserved a second chance. I always think that the danger at the moment is that he is effectively being punished twice for the same offence, he said.`` I gave him a second chance. I think that sometimes in life it is right to give someone a second chance.'' Mr David Cameron insisted that Mr Andy Coulson was doing his job
